addMagazinePool.description: Add magazines to the magazine pool, of which the player may choose in the following mission. Available in campaigns only.

addWeaponPool.description: Add weapons to the weapon pool, of which the player may choose in the following mission. Available in campaigns only.

animate.description: Activates given object animation. Animation is defined in CfgModels animations class.

animationPhase.description: Returns the phase of the given animation on the given object. Animation can be scripted (animate, animateSource, animateDoor) or engine driven. Animation names for an object could be found out with animationNames command. When animation is rotation, like with "MainTurret" for example, the output is in radians, to convert to degrees use deg command.
animationPhase.example: _building animate ["maindoor",1]; sleep 1; _p = _building animationPhase "maindoor"; returns 1 (if the animation speed is <= 2 seconds)

cheatsEnabled.description: Checks whether cheats are enabled (whether the designers' version is running).

clearMagazinePool.description: Remove all magazines from the magazine pool, of which the player may choose in the following missions. Available in campaigns only.

clearWeaponPool.description: Remove all weapons from the weapon pool, of which the player may choose in the following missions. Available in campaigns only.

deleteIdentity.description: Delete an identity (created with saveIdentity) from the campaign's progress file.

deleteStatus.description: Delete a status (created with saveStatus) from the campaign's progress file.

drop.description: Creates a particle effect. This command is used to create smoke, fire and similar effects. The particles are single polygons with single textures that always face the player. They can be set to dynamically change their position, size, direction, can be set to different weights and more or less dependant on the wind.

fillWeaponsFromPool.description: Adds magazines from the campaign pool to the given unit, depending on his weapons.

loadIdentity.description: Loads person's identity from Objects.sav file in campaign directory (from entry name).

loadStatus.description: Loads object's properties from Objects.sav file in campaign directory (from entry name).

magazines.description: Returns array of type names of all vehicle's magazines. When applied to a unit (soldier), the command behaves differently and will omit magazines already loaded into unit's weapons. Use currentMagazine to get this information for a currently loaded magazine.

object.description: Return Object with given id. Object ID's can be checked in mission editor.

onBriefingGear.description: Select a sound declared in the Description.ext of the mission to be played the first time the Gear tab is selected in the briefing.

onBriefingGroup.description: Select a sound declared in the Description.ext of the mission to be played the first time the Group tab is selected in the briefing.

onBriefingNotes.description: Select a sound declared in the Description.ext of the mission to be played the first time the Notes tab is selected in the briefing.

onBriefingPlan.description: Select a sound declared in the Description.ext of the mission to be played the first time the Plan tab is selected in the briefing.

pickWeaponPool.description: Transfer weapons and magazines from cargo of object into weapon pool (used in campaign to transfer weapons into next mission).

primaryWeapon.description: Returns name of unit's primary weapon (empty string if none).

putWeaponPool.description: Transfer weapons and magazines from weapon pool into cargo of given object. Used in campaign to transfer weapons into next mission.

queryMagazinePool.description: Return number of magazines of type name in magazine pool (used in campaign to transfer magazines into next mission).

queryWeaponPool.description: Return number of weapons of type name in weapon pool (used in campaign to transfer weapons into next mission).

resize.description: Changes the size of the given array. The command does not return new array, it resizes the source array to the desired number of elements. If the new size is bigger than the current size, the new places are filled with nils.

saveIdentity.description: Saves person's identity to Objects.sav file in campaign directory as entry name.

saveStatus.description: Saves object's properties to Objects.sav file in campaign directory as entry name.

secondaryWeapon.description: Returns name of a unit's secondary weapon (empty string if none).

set.description: Changes the element at the given (zero-based) index of the array.

setObjectTexture.description: Textures object selection with texture named in array. Array has the form [selectionNumber, "Texture"].

setRain.description: Set rain density smoothly over the given transition time (in seconds). A transition time of zero means an immediate change. A rain density of zero is no rain, one is maximum rain. Rain is not possible when overcast is less than 0.7.

setSkill.description: Sets ability level of person (commander unit). Value of skill may vary from 0 to 1.

setTerrainGrid.description: Sets the desired terrain resolution (in meters). For default landscapes the supported resolutions are:

skill.description: Returns current level of ability of a unit, in range between 0 and 1, 1 being the highest level of skill.

weapons.description: Returns array of names of all Unit's weapons.

dialog.description: Tests whether any user dialog is open.

enemy.description: Enemy side (enemy to all units). This command is not functional and appears to have be replaced by sideEnemy.

sideEnemy.description: The enemy side (used for renegades). Unit of this side is enemy to everyone.
sideEnemy.example: if (side player == sideEnemy) then { hint "We've got a renegade!"; };

sideFriendly.description: The Friendly side - friendly to all, see Side relations.
sideFriendly.example: if (side player == sideFriendly) then { hint "I feel friendly today!"; };

missionName.description: Return currently loaded mission file (path to mission.pbo, relative to game exe).
missionName.example: hint format ["You are playing mission ""%1""", missionName];

missionStart.description: Returns date and time when mission started in format [year, month, day, hour, minute, second] in MP, which differs from date format only by seconds. In SP returns [0,0,0,0,0,0].

playersNumber.description: Returns count of occupied role selection slots for given side. Players who claimed a slot in the lobby but didn't start the mission are counted as well. If disabledAI = 0; in description.ext or Enable AI option is checked in 3DEN, AI bots will be treated as valid players and will be counted too. Multiplayer only, in singleplayer always returns 0.
playersNumber.example: _west = playersNumber west; _east = playersNumber east; _civ = playersNumber civilian; hint format ["West:%1 East:%2, Civ:%3", _west, _east, _civ];

setVelocity.description: Set velocity (speed vector) of a vehicle. Units are in metres per second.

velocity.description: Return velocity (speed vector) of Unit as an array with format [x, y, z].

addEventHandler.description: Adds event handler (EH) to the given object and returns EH handle. If EH has some data to return upon event (e.g. the "killed" EH will return an array with 2 elements: the killed unit, and the killer), it is passed in _this variable. Since Arma 3 v.1.63.137807 the EH handle is also stored in _thisEventHandler variable and is available during EH code execution.

call.description: Adds given set of compiled instructions to the current stack and waits for it to finish and return, provides an option to pass arguments to the executed Code.

comment.description: Define a comment. Mainly used in SQF Syntax, as you're able to introduce comment lines with semicolons in a SQS script.
comment.example: script.sqs comment "This is a commented line"

do.description: Executes code. Used as part of a construct, such as while, with, for and switch. The code is always executed in missionNamespace unless do is used with with as an argument.
do.example: while { b > a } do { a = a + 1 };

else.description: Executes else code when if condition returns false
else.example: if (a > b) then { c = 0 } else { c = 1 };

if.description: This operator creates a If Type which is used in the if-construct as described here.
if.example: _retVal = if (1 > 0) then { "It's true" } else { "It's false" }; hint str _retVal

onMapSingleClick.description: Define action performed when user clicks in map by executing command string. The code is executed on every click, until the command is
onMapSingleClick.example: ArmA: Creates a soldier unit at the position clicked: onMapSingleClick "'SoldierWB' createUnit [_pos, group player]; true";

preprocessFile.description: Reads and processes the content of the specified file. Preprocessor is C-like, supports comments using // or /* and */ and PreProcessor Commands.

removeAllEventHandlers.description: Removes all event handlers of given type that were added by addEventHandler. Since VBS2 v1.24 can be applied on individual weapon rounds.

removeEventHandler.description: Removes event handler added by addEventHandler. When any handler is removed, all handler indices higher than the deleted one should be decremented.

sliderPosition.description: Return current thumb position of slider idc of topmost user dialog.

sliderRange.description: Return limits, as an Array [min, max] of slider idc of topmost user dialog.

sliderSetPosition.description: Set current thumb position of slider idc of topmost user dialog.

sliderSetRange.description: Set limits of slider idc of topmost user dialog.

sliderSetSpeed.description: Set speed of slider with id idc of topmost user dialog.

sliderSpeed.description: Return speed, as an Array [min, max] of slider idc of topmost user dialog.

then.description: First or second element of array is executed depending on result of if condition. Result of the expression executed is returned as a result (result may be Nothing).

while.description: Repeats Code while condition is true. A part of while do construct.

engineOn.description: Activates and deactivates the engine of a vehicle. This command has to be executed where vehicle is local. NOTE: Executed on a remote vehicle this command may turn the engine on but then it will get turned off by itself after a short while.

isEngineOn.description: Returns true if engine is on, false if it is off.

loadFile.description: Return content of given filename as string. If you plan to compile said string, be aware that the file shouldn't contain comments or compile will throw an error. If there are comments, use preprocessFile/preprocessFileLineNumbers instead.

sideLogic.example: if (side _obj == sideLogic) then { hint "It's a logic!"; };

typeOf.description: Returns the config class name of given object or "" if object doesn't have config class.
typeOf.example: if (typeOf vehicle player == "B_Heli_Light_01_armed_F") then {hint "Player is in AH-9 Pawnee"};
